template.template: Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP
template.name: Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP
template.description:
Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0(3)T
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB SNMPv2-MIB OLD-CISCO-CPU-MIB CISCO-ENVMON-MIB CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB ENTITY-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.41

trigger.expression: max(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/icmpping,#3)=0
trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

trigger.expression: min(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: High ICMP ping loss

dependency.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
dependency.expression: max(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/icmpping,#3)=0

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: min(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100

dependency.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
dependency.expression: max(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/icmpping,#3)=0

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: The item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

item.name: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: MIB: OLD-CISCO-CPU-MIB 5 minute exponentially-decayed moving average of the CPU busy percentage. Reference: http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15215-collect-cpu-util-snmp.html

trigger.name: High CPU utilization
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item.name: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

trigger.expression: last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber,#1)<>last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber,#2) and length(last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber))>0
trigger.name: Device has been replaced
trigger.event_name: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

item.name: Uptime (hardware)
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

item.name: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

trigger.expression: last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.name))>0
trigger.name: System name has changed
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Uptime (network)
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Fred Router'.

trigger.expression: last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.sw.os[sysDescr.0],#1)<>last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.sw.os[sysDescr.0],#2) and length(last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.sw.os[sysDescr.0]))>0
trigger.name: Operating system description has changed
trigger.description: Operating system description has changed. Possible reasons that system has been updated or replaced. Ack to close.

dependency.name: System name has changed
dependency.expression: last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.name))>0

item.name: SNMP agent availability
item.description: Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list. Possible value: 0 - not available 1 - available 2 - unknown

trigger.name: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

dependency.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
dependency.expression: max(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/icmpping,#3)=0

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Device has been replaced
trigger_prototype.event_name: {#ENT_NAME}: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

discovery_rule.name: FAN Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The table of fan status maintained by the environmental monitor.

trigger_prototype.expression: count(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$FAN_CRIT_STATUS:\"critical\"}")=1 or count(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$FAN_CRIT_STATUS:\"shutdown\"}")=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Fan is in critical state

trigger_prototype.expression: count(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$FAN_WARN_STATUS:\"warning\"}")=1 or count(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$FAN_WARN_STATUS:\"notFunctioning\"}")=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Fan is in warning state

dependency.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Fan is in critical state
dependency.expression: count(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$FAN_CRIT_STATUS:\"critical\"}")=1 or count(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$FAN_CRIT_STATUS:\"shutdown\"}")=1

discovery_rule.name: Memory Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoMemoryPoolTable, a table of memory pool monitoring entries. http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Free memory
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the managed device. Note that the sum of ciscoMemoryPoolUsed and ciscoMemoryPoolFree is the total amount of memory in the pool Reference: http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Used memory
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently in use by applications on the managed device. Reference: http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: High memory utilization
trigger_prototype.description: The system is running out of free memory.

item.host: Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP

discovery_rule.name: PSU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The table of power supply status maintained by the environmental monitor card.

trigger_prototype.expression: count(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$PSU_CRIT_STATUS:\"critical\"}")=1 or count(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$PSU_CRIT_STATUS:\"shutdown\"}")=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Power supply is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the power supply unit for errors

trigger_prototype.expression: count(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$PSU_WARN_STATUS:\"warning\"}")=1 or count(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$PSU_WARN_STATUS:\"notFunctioning\"}")=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Power supply is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the power supply unit for errors

dependency.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Power supply is in critical state
dependency.expression: count(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$PSU_CRIT_STATUS:\"critical\"}")=1 or count(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$PSU_CRIT_STATUS:\"shutdown\"}")=1

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoEnvMonTemperatureTable (ciscoEnvMonTemperatureDescr), a table of ambient temperature status maintained by the environmental monitor.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-ENVMON-MIB The current state of the test point being instrumented.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-ENVMON-MIB The current measurement of the test point being instrumented.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature is above critical threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature is above warning threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature is above critical threshold

trigger.expression: (last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])>0 and last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])<10m) or (last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])=0 and last(/Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP/system.net.uptime[sysUpTime.0])<10m)
trigger.name: Host has been restarted

item.host: Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T by SNMP
